Desc.entry: Part of Sheffield Libraries, Archives and Information. Stock and facilities include: A3 and A4 photocopier, fax service (sending and receiving), newspapers and journals, Ordnance Survey maps, CDs, language tapes, talking books, DVDs and videos. A wide range of groups meet at the library including Brush Strokes art group. Activities include computer courses, Baby Time and Councillors and MP surgeries. Provides 9 People's Network computers with Microsoft Office, Internet access and a scanner available for public use.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon 10am-5.30pm, Tues 9am-5.30pm, Wed closed, Thurs 9am-7pm, Fri 9.30am-7pm, Sat 9.30am-4pm (opening times); Mon & Fri 10am-12.30pm (Women's Group, craft for the over 60s, see separate entry), Mon 1.30-2.30pm (PEEP child development course), Tues 2-3pm (Story Time for under 5s, term-time only), Wed 11am-1pm, (sequence dancing), Thurs 2-3.30pm (Glass Mountain Writers, see separate entry), 2-4pm (Stitches Circle), 7.30-9.30pm (Local and Live Amateur Group, see separate entry), Fri 9.30am-12noon (mums and tums), 10am-12noon (bereavement drop-in, see separate entry), 2-4pm (Brush Strokes, see separate entry), 5.30-6.30pm (Friday Club, aged 7-13 years, term-time only), one Mon in the month 2-3pm (reading group, see separate entry), 1st, 3rd & 4th Tues in the month 10am-1pm (Cross Stitch Club), 1st Tues in the month 2.15-3.15pm (first Tuesday Talks, various speakers), 1st, 2nd & 4th Sat in the month 10-11am (Councillor's Surgery), 3rd Sat in the month 9.30-11am (MP's Surgery, except Aug)
